text: Sir Don Gabriel Daza (February 6, 1896 â€“ May 18, 1994) was a Filipino electrical engineer who was a co-founder of Filipino corporations such as the Philippine Long Distance Telephone Company (PLDT), together with Joseph E. Stevenot, and the Philippine Electric Manufacturing Company (PEMCO). He was also known for being one of the founding fathers of the Boy Scout movement in the Philippines where he became acting president and Chief Scout. ==References== Category:1896 births Category:1994 deaths Category:Engineers Category:Filipino businesspeople Category:People from Eastern Samar
title: Gabriel Daza
